job_description: Our mission as research center: Discover personalized medical solutions for environmentally triggered diseases to promote a healthier society in a rapidly changing world.The newly established Institute for Tissue Engineering and Regenerative Medicine (ITERM) develops and implements 3D imaging technologies to enable development of personalized medicine for complicated diseases including cancer, neurodegeneration and metabolic disorders. At ITERM, we bring together cutting-edge science from biology, chemistry, engineering, and computer applications. Our overarching aim is to study biological systems as a whole in an unbiased way. We use deep learning-based algorithms (AI) to analyze large imaging and molecular data.We are seeking a highly motivated and talented PI level scientist (at least 3 years of experience as a group leader) or senior postdoc (at least 4 years of experience in guiding projects and students) (f/m/x) to act as the Deputy Director of our Institute.Deputy Director (f/m/x) for ITERM 101434 Full time Neuherberg near MunichYour responsibilitiesSupport the development of strategic institutional targets, mentor students, and help manuscript preparationsManagement of diverse scientific projects and grantsDevelop and write grant applications for the institute and coordinate and manage the post-award activities including communication with multiple academic / legal partnersSupport hiring process for new talents and the communication with HRSupport the activities around our spin-offYour qualificationsA PhD in life or computer sciences field and several years of postdoctoral experience in a relevant field (i.e: in vivo mouse work, cell culture, organoids, omics, nanotechnology, 3D bioprinting)Extensive experience in supervising PhD students and postdocsBroad experience in project management and grant applicationsDemonstrated aptitude to organize, coordinate and write scientific reports, manuscripts, and grant applicationsFinally, excellent communication skills in English, team player mentality, independence and problem-solving skills are expectedWhat we offer youMunich, with its numerous lakes and its vicinity to the Alps, is considered to be one of the cities with the best quality of life worldwide.
